title: The use of corrosion resistant reinforcement - the chance for durable concrete reinforced structures

author: Marijana Serdar, Faculty of civil engineering, University of Zagreb

segmentation: OK hello everybody, my name is Mariana Sirdar and I'm a PhD student at Faculty of Civil Engineering, University of Zagreb, Croatia.

An I have been involved in arches project from the very beginning, so it is always challenging to to summarize the three years work in 20 minutes talk, but I will do my best to do it and not to brag too much about the results that we obtained so.
So as you already heard, this is.

This talk is about working package tree and more precisely about the first sub task of work package package tree and it was the name of the sub task was corrosion resistant steel reinforcement or lower alloyed steel reinforcement that we called it those days.

The outline of the presentation will be the I will shortly talk about the background on durability problems, but Doctor Leggett already mentioned something so that I will just quickly run through them and then I will show you what was the name and the idea of the motivation for the work that we did and what were the results.
The conclusions, so as you probably know, working in civil engineering the the idea is to make structures more durable, to make them stable.
Functional an eye static to have their static properties for longer period of time.
So for structures such as bridges it is more than 50 years, so it's more 100 years.
So this is the the problem that is often seen in practice.
Data structures are usually.
Not build this way, the approaches to their ability design these days are more deemed to satisfy design, which means, actually, that.

Today, according to European start that we follow in most countries there six different environmental classes and you pick environmental class in which your structure will fall into and then you have a specific rules that you have to follow in order to make a structure allows for 50 years.
The question is what if you have structure that needs to last 400 years then you have to do something more.
You have to either use better material or you have other solutions and doctor.
Older we will talk about other alternatives that you can use.
So in I will show you some of the examples in Croatia.
Some of those are really old structures, severely decorated due to corrosion.
This sister paid or structuring.
Reeka kirkbridge and there was a lot of talk about this bridge and you will see some other pictures of it.
You can see here that it is really nice example but nice examples of corrosion as well.
Here on the column.
And here is a new bridge.
It is only 10 years old, but you can already see some really nice Booktype examples of corrosion.
On the bridge.
So the idea is to find the material that will last under carbonation and chloride attack as well, because these are the two main reasons.

For corrosion of steel in concrete, what happens with carbonation is it is a natural process and we cannot stop it, so the carbon dioxide reacts with something which is in cement an in concrete calcium hydroxide an consequently pH of concrete decreases.
Then as a consequence of this the passive layer around steel reinforcement is destabilized and.
Occur.
Vision can can occur.
The other instance are chlorides and when they are present in four solution they they destabilized passively around reinforcement and they consequently cause.
Corrosion as well, so these are the two things that we are trying to find material which will be resistant to these two types of attacks.
What are the consequences that we are trying not to cause in concrete structures and you already saw 2T of this diagram before in Doctor Leggett's presentation?
These are examples of cracking spalling, loss of bone and at the end you have call up something that is called propagation phase and you don't.
Want this to happen in your structure.
So what was the idea of the research?

The idea is to use different types of reinforcement which are resistant to corrosion but are not expensive as the typical used stainless steel that you usually use and you were using it while you were eating today, your lunch so not to use this expensive type of steel, but to use some other alternative types of steel that are cheaper but good 400 years service life.
An aim of the research was first to find which steel types are those, then to get them and then to evaluate their efficiency in different environments.
An at the end to say what are their limits, limits state application.
Where can they be used for what type of structures and in what type of environmental.
Here are the list of shows and steel grades and of course black steel reinforcement was chosen as comparison.
An highly stainless steels like three or four were chosen for comparison purposes as well.

If you look here at the content of chromium and nickel you can see that these types of steel, three or four and duplex types of steel have larger content of chromium and large content of nickel, and for comparison these two types of steel that we have chosen for.
Research had lower content of nickel, so we're trying to see whether they are as.
Good or they can if they can be used for the for the purpose of civil engineering.
Concrete structures of course, as a civil engineer is the first thing you want is for your material to have the same mechanical properties.
So after this was checked and we realized that this was.
OK, then we started to do experimental problem program concerning corrosion properties.
I will show you just briefly the what we did.

What type of tests we did, the idea it was to 1st do a larger amount of easy more easy tests in poor solution which which is chemically more more clear because you have a poor solution that you know the chemistry of solution that is known and you have a steel electrode inside.
Then we moved to more complicated systems with the steels embedded in concrete and at the end we have filled up field applications.
So we did all the steps to see the full scale the proper.
Use of these types of steel, so first testing was done.
Import solution.
We have different pH values to see the concrete to simulate concrete which is carbonated and noncarbonated envy added different concentration of chloride and we did all numerous methods.
Electrochemical methods to to test them.
We did tests in on different types of specimens.
We did cross section tests to see the inside of the material, and we did tests in outer surface of the steel specimens to see there.
The difference in their behavior.
We used anodic polarization method and.
So here are some of the results that I will show you just to get image of what we were investigating.
If you follow the.
HAHA, which is the laser?
Probably yes.
If you follow this picture here, you can see that from from the length of this.
Here you can see how passive the steel actually is in media.
So if you look at these examples here, you can see that the this this.
Is quite wide, so this still is quite passive.
But if you look here you can see that black steel reinforcement is not passive at all.
It starts to corrode almost immediately.
So you want to see how far this.
Is so.
We were comparing types of steel and you can see that all types of silver had better properties than black steel reinforcement.
Then we did.
Then
I did the electric chemical impedance spectroscopy, which is another method Doctor Leggett was talking about.
As well, and you can see here from the how big the circle on the picture is you can.
You can actually see what is the resistance to corrosion of specific material.

So if you look at you can see that there is a wide spectrum of resistance to corrosion of different types of steel, so you can actually choose what sometimes you don't need your your material to last for 1000 year and you will not pay for that amount.
So you can always choose from the Spectra of.
Corrosion resistance what?
Type of material you will.
You will use.
Then we did accelerated corrosion testing in so called.
My pops in sports small specimens we test.
Damn Electro chemically.
Then again, we did linear Poly polarization to see the corrosion corrosion rates and we did electrochemical impedance spectroscopy to see which still be.
Gives better or what are the ranges of resistance of the steals.

After that we did some laboratory simulation of aggressive aggressive environments in salt spray chamber and by point bonding and this part was actually done by from our colleagues in Autostrada in Italy.
You can see here that that space humans were put in salt spray chamber and here we simulated address.
Marine environments you can see some of the results here and testing will move further away through years.
We will not stop with the with the.
Last days of artist.
Broad project.
These types of specimens were performed in were prepared in zag an there were some electrical resistant probes embedded.
In them, an few of the results are shown here, so you can see that some steels are not so passive, they the corrosion rate is somewhat larger higher than the other still.
So you can see the Spectra of.
Resistance of the steels at the end.
What we did.
We applied this steel store real field test zone so we made.
Concrete, big concrete columns.
There were three meters long, reinforced with heavily reinforced with different types of reinforcement to see their natural behavior.
In aggressive environment, we chose this location since it's so attractive.
Location near Adriatik cost near Craig Bridge that you've already seen that is heavily.
We decorated you to corrosion.

We chose to make two types of columns with different different types of connecting reinforcement just to see different solutions for practical application whether to connect them with black steel wires or just to make some special connecting things for the special types of steel.
So we will see in practice how they behave under aggressive.
Elements.
You can see here how the testing site was was.
Prepared and they told me if you if it took you six months to do something, you don't have to talk about it for another six months to other people.
I will just show you the pictures.
This was extremely heavily to do because we have in Croatia really harsh administrative forces and you cannot really place anything under the bridge, so this was a really success to do.
Now we have this really nice really attractive test site that we will continuously monitor during.
During years, of course, in this in this columns electrical resistant probes were embedded, so now we will.
We will actually monitor corrosion with the probes with other instruments that enable corrosion monitoring and we will be able to see how different types of steel, actually, how are their properties.
Actually, when they are applied on site, what was the main outcome of the project and what we wanted to achieve?
We wanted to propose a tailored application of corrosion resistant steel, so if you are an end user, you want to know you have a structure in specific environment.
We wanted to show you that you can actually choose not the most expensive, so it's not either to use stainless steel or not to use it.
You can actually use a wide strained of.

Different types of steel and we actually made really easy tables to for end users to just know if they have a specific environment which types of steel are good to be used in this type of environment and they are connected to environments from European standards 206 for concrete structures that we all use in there.

To practice the main conclusion of three year of Earth project is that with smart and tailored application of corrosion resistant reinforcement, service life of structures can be prolonged under a safe, acceptable price which is really of importance when you are investor of course and more on guidelines and recommendations can be found in our document that we have just finished an.
It's called recommendations for the use of corrosion.
Distance still reinforcement.
I would really like to use this opportunity to thank all the people who helped me and other people during the these three years specially would like to thank to steel producers.
Some of them are here today with us.
An big thank you to people from Croatia who were actually working on test site for free just because we asked them really nicely.
They they did all the work for nothing just for thank you.
So I really have to.
You used.
Opportunity to take them and of course thank you for your attention.
Thank you very much.
My, you know.
